ground_truth: He opens another drawer and pulls out various sandwiches wrapped in wax paper, a salt and pepper shaker, a tube of mustard, a bottle of red wine, and two Dixie cups. He uncorks the wine, fills a cup, and begins eating. He hands her a sandwich and fills a wine-cup for her. He reaches back into the drawer and pulls out a glass which he gives her. FOUR MEN, all in army uniform, sit behind a table. The glass is held over the first, magnifying the face. It's a photo of a young CHARLES LAMPERT. The glass and CAMERA move to the fourth face -- a young. REGGIE nods. He writes something on a pad of paper and tears it off, handing it to her. A ROAR from the CHILDREN. REGGIE and PETER turn toward the stage. PUNCH and JUDY are arguing loudly. PUNCH and JUDY are batting each other on the head. Finally, JUDY knocks Punch out of sight and a PUPPET wearing a three-cornered hat appears. Wearing a hat, he stands off in the background, watching. JUDY and the POLICEMAN are batting one another. PUNCH's head appears on the other side of the stage, says something, then ducks out. Charles was mixed up in something terrible. JUDY has gotten the upper hand and is now batting the POLICEMAN's brains out. CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE as he winces. He stands on the dance floor in front of a five-piece Latin dance band, a spotlight on him, wearing his professional smile as he speaks into a mike. At their table, REGGIE is dressed in a lovely Givenchy dress. As REGGIE hauls off and kicks GIDEON full in the shin, he stiffens as the pain registers. Instead of shouting, he merely closes his eyes. Including REGGIE and GIDEON and PETER standing by, as well as some spectators. PETER comes quickly forward. REGGIE realizes that GIDEON no longer offers any resistance. She steps back, leaving GIDEON holding the orange, foolishly, under his chin, his eyes still closed. REGGIE stares at him for a moment. Slowly, his eyes open, and tears stream from them, rolling down his cheeks. He speaks while holding the orange. GIDEON turns to the woman behind him and the game resumes. She realizes she has not pushed the button which takes her coin and allows the party at the other end to hear her voice. TEX takes a book of matches from his pocket. He strikes a match and lights his cigarette, holding the burning match in his hand afterward. TEX, without a word, throws the still-lit match into the booth, onto REGGIE's lap. She beats it out frantically. He lights another match and reaches out toward her hair with it.

Slowly, his eyes open, tears streaming from them, rolling down his cheeks. While holding the orange, he speaks. To the woman behind him, GIDEON turns, and the game is resumed. She realizes she has not pushed the button that takes her coin and allows the party at the other end to hear her voice. A book of matches is taken from his pocket by TEX. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He carefully opens yet another drawer and proceeds to pull out an assortment of sandwiches, each one neatly wrapped in wax paper. Alongside these, he retrieves a salt and pepper shaker, a tube of mustard, a bottle of rich red wine, and two simple Dixie cups. With a practiced motion, he uncorks the wine, pours it generously into a cup, and begins to eat his meal. He thoughtfully hands her a sandwich and fills a wine-cup for her as well. Reaching back into the drawer, he finds a glass, which he graciously offers to her. Seated behind a table are FOUR MEN, all clad in army uniforms. The glass is held over the first man, magnifying his face. It is a photograph of a young CHARLES LAMPERT. The glass and CAMERA shift focus to the fourth face—a young man. REGGIE acknowledges this with a nod. He writes something down on a pad of paper, tears off the sheet, and hands it to her. Suddenly, a ROAR erupts from the CHILDREN. Both REGGIE and PETER turn their attention toward the stage. PUNCH and JUDY are engaged in a loud argument. They are comically hitting each other on the head. Eventually, JUDY manages to knock Punch out of sight, and a PUPPET wearing a distinctive three-cornered hat makes an appearance. Standing in the background, wearing a hat, he observes the scene. JUDY and the POLICEMAN are now hitting each other. PUNCH's head pops up on the opposite side of the stage, says something, and then quickly ducks out of view. Charles was involved in something dreadful. JUDY gains the upper hand and is now hitting the POLICEMAN with great enthusiasm. CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE winces visibly. He stands on the dance floor, positioned in front of a lively five-piece Latin dance band, a spotlight illuminating him as he speaks into a microphone, wearing his professional smile. At their table, REGGIE is elegantly dressed in a stunning Givenchy dress. As REGGIE forcefully kicks GIDEON in the shin, he stiffens as the pain registers. Instead of shouting, he simply closes his eyes. Including REGGIE, GIDEON, and PETER standing nearby, as well as some onlookers. PETER quickly steps forward. REGGIE realizes that GIDEON is no longer resisting. She steps back, leaving GIDEON holding the orange awkwardly under his chin, his eyes still shut. REGGIE gazes at him for a moment. Slowly, his eyes open, and tears begin to stream down his cheeks. He speaks while still holding the orange. GIDEON turns to the woman behind him, and the game continues. She suddenly realizes she has not pressed the button that takes her coin and allows the person on the other end to hear her voice. TEX takes a book of matches from his pocket. He strikes a match and lights his cigarette, holding the burning match in his hand afterward. Without uttering a word, TEX throws the still-lit match into the booth, landing it on REGGIE's lap. She frantically beats it out. He lights another match and reaches out toward her hair with it.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With meticulous care, he opens yet another drawer, methodically pulling out an assortment of sandwiches, each one perfectly and neatly wrapped in protective wax paper. Alongside these sandwiches, he retrieves a pair of shakers filled with salt and pepper, a tube of mustard, a bottle brimming with rich, red wine, and two simple, disposable Dixie cups. With a practiced and deft motion, he uncorks the wine, pouring it generously into one of the cups before beginning to enjoy his meal. Thoughtfully, he hands her a sandwich and fills a separate wine cup for her as well. Reaching back into the same drawer, he finds a glass, which he graciously offers to her. Sitting behind a table are FOUR MEN, all dressed in standard army uniforms. The glass is held above the first man, magnifying his face; it's a photograph of a young CHARLES LAMPERT. The glass and CAMERA smoothly shift focus to the fourth face—a young man. REGGIE acknowledges this with a subtle nod. He writes something down on a pad of paper, then tears off the sheet and hands it to her. Suddenly, a loud ROAR erupts from the CHILDREN, catching everyone's attention. Both REGGIE and PETER redirect their focus toward the stage. There, PUNCH and JUDY are engaged in a loud, heated argument, comically hitting each other on the head. Eventually, JUDY succeeds in knocking Punch out of sight, after which a PUPPET wearing a distinctive three-cornered hat makes an appearance. Standing unobtrusively in the background, wearing a hat, he quietly observes the unfolding scene. JUDY and the POLICEMAN are now hitting each other with gusto. Suddenly, PUNCH's head pops up on the opposite side of the stage, says something, and then quickly ducks out of view. Charles was involved in something dreadful. As JUDY gains the upper hand, she is hitting the POLICEMAN with great enthusiasm. In a CLOSE SHOT, GRANDPIERRE visibly winces. He stands on the dance floor, positioned prominently in front of a lively five-piece Latin dance band, a spotlight illuminating him as he speaks into a microphone, all while wearing his professional smile. At their table, REGGIE is elegantly dressed in a stunning Givenchy dress. Suddenly, REGGIE forcefully kicks GIDEON in the shin, causing him to stiffen as the sharp pain registers. Instead of shouting, he simply closes his eyes in silence. Among those watching are REGGIE, GIDEON, and PETER standing nearby, as well as some onlookers. PETER quickly steps forward. REGGIE realizes that GIDEON is no longer resisting. She steps back, leaving GIDEON holding the orange awkwardly under his chin, his eyes still shut. REGGIE gazes at him for a contemplative moment. Slowly, his eyes open, and tears begin to stream down his cheeks. He starts to speak while still holding the orange. GIDEON then turns to the woman behind him, and the game continues unabated. She suddenly realizes she has not pressed the button that allows her coin to be taken and permits the person on the other end to hear her voice. TEX takes a book of matches from his pocket. With a quick motion, he strikes a match and lights his cigarette, holding the still-burning match in his hand afterward. Without uttering a word, TEX throws the still-lit match into the booth, where it lands on REGGIE's lap, causing her to frantically beat it out. He lights another match and reaches out toward her hair with it threateningly.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He carefully opens another drawer, his fingers deftly searching through its contents, and begins to pull out various sandwiches, each one neatly wrapped in wax paper. Alongside the sandwiches, he retrieves a salt and pepper shaker, a tube of mustard, a bottle of red wine, and two Dixie cups, arranging them methodically on the surface in front of him. With a practiced motion, he uncorks the wine, the cork making a soft pop as it releases, and pours the rich, red liquid into one of the cups until it is nearly full. He takes a sip, savoring the taste, before beginning to eat one of the sandwiches. He then hands her a sandwich, ensuring she has something to eat, and fills a wine-cup for her, offering it with a gentle gesture. Reaching back into the drawer, he searches momentarily before pulling out a glass, which he hands to her with a nod. Meanwhile, four men, all clad in army uniforms, sit behind a table, their presence commanding attention. The glass is held over the first man, magnifying his face, revealing it to be a photo of a young Charles Lampert. The glass and camera shift focus to the fourth face, capturing the details of the young man. Reggie nods in acknowledgment, then writes something on a pad of paper, the pen moving swiftly across the page. He tears off the sheet and hands it to her, the paper rustling softly. Suddenly, a roar erupts from the children, drawing Reggie and Peter's attention toward the stage where Punch and Judy are engaged in a loud argument. The puppets are animated, batting each other on the head with exaggerated motions. Finally, Judy delivers a decisive blow, knocking Punch out of sight, and a puppet wearing a three-cornered hat makes its appearance. In the background, a man wearing a hat stands, observing the scene with interest. Judy and the Policeman continue their comical battle, each strike landing with a thud. Punch's head reappears on the opposite side of the stage, says something inaudible, then quickly ducks out of view. The narrative shifts, revealing that Charles was involved in something terrible. Judy gains the upper hand, relentlessly battering the Policeman's brains out, her puppet movements swift and decisive. In a close shot, Grandpierre winces, his expression pained. He stands on the dance floor, positioned in front of a five-piece Latin dance band, a spotlight illuminating him as he speaks into a microphone, his professional smile unwavering. At their table, Reggie is elegantly dressed in a lovely Givenchy dress, her appearance striking. As Reggie suddenly hauls off and kicks Gideon full in the shin, he stiffens, the pain registering sharply, yet instead of shouting, he merely closes his eyes, enduring the discomfort. The scene includes Reggie, Gideon, and Peter standing by, along with some spectators observing the unfolding drama. Peter quickly steps forward, his movements purposeful. Reggie realizes that Gideon no longer offers any resistance, prompting her to step back, leaving Gideon holding an orange foolishly under his chin, his eyes still closed. Reggie stares at him for a moment, her gaze steady. Slowly, his eyes open, and tears begin to stream from them, rolling down his cheeks as he speaks, still holding the orange. Gideon turns to the woman behind him, and the game resumes, the atmosphere shifting back to normalcy. She suddenly realizes she has not pushed the button that takes her coin and allows the party at the other end to hear her voice, a moment of realization dawning on her. Tex, standing nearby, takes a book of matches from his pocket, his fingers deftly flipping it open. He strikes a match, the flame flaring to life, and lights his cigarette, holding the burning match in his hand afterward. Without uttering a word, Tex throws the still-lit match into the booth, where it lands on Reggie's lap, causing her to beat it out frantically, her movements hurried and panicked. He lights another match, the flame flickering, and reaches out toward her hair with it, the threat implicit in his actions.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He opens another drawer and pulls out various sandwiches wrapped in wax paper a salt and pepper shaker a tube of mustard a bottle of red wine and two Dixie cups. He uncorks the wine fills a cup and begins eating. He hands her a sandwich and fills a winecup for her. He reaches back into the drawer and pulls out a glass which he gives her. FOUR MEN all in army uniform sit behind a table. The glass is held over the first magnifying the face. It is a photo of a young CHARLES LAMPERT. The glass and CAMERA move to the fourth face. a young REGGIE nods. He writes something on a pad of paper and tears it off handing it to her. A ROAR from the CHILDREN. REGGIE and PETER turn toward the stage. PUNCH and JUDY are arguing loudly. PUNCH and JUDY are batting each other on the head. Finally JUDY knocks Punch out of sight and a PUPPET wearing a threecornered hat appears. Wearing a hat he stands off in the background watching JUDY and the POLICEMAN are batting one another. PUNCH's head appears on the other side of the stage says something then ducks out. Charles was mixed up in something terrible. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. JUDY has gotten the upper hand and is now batting the POLICEMAN's brains out. CLOSE SHOT  GRANDPIERRE as he winces. He stands on the dance floor in front of a fivepiece Latin dance band a spotlight on him wearing his professional smile as he speaks into a mike. At their table REGGIE is dressed in a lovely Givenchy dress. As REGGIE hauls off and kicks GIDEON full in the shin he stiffens as the pain registers. Instead of shouting he merely closes his eyes Including REGGIE and GIDEON and PETER standing by as well as some spectators. PETER comes quickly forward. REGGIE realizes that GIDEON no longer offers any resistance. She steps back leaving GIDEON holding the orange foolishly under his chin his eyes still closed. REGGIE stares at him for a moment. Slowly his eyes open and tears stream from them rolling down his cheeks. He speaks while holding the orange. GIDEON turns to the woman behind him and the game resumes. She realizes she has not pushed the button which takes her coin and allows the party at the other end to hear her voice. TEX takes a book of matches from his pocket. He strikes a match and lights his cigarette holding the burning match in his hand. afterward TEX without a word throws the stilllit match into the booth onto REGGIE's lap. She beats it out frantically. He lights another match and reaches out toward her hair with it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The mouse unseals another shoebox and extracts various doughnuts wrapped in tin foil, a spool of thread, a jar of mayonnaise, a carton of apple juice, and seven goblets. The mouse pops open the juice, fills a goblet, and begins painting. The mouse tosses him a doughnut and pours an apple-juice-goblet for him. The mouse dives back into the shoebox and pulls out a whistle which it tosses to her. FOUR ROBOTS, all in business suits, stand before a podium. The whistle is dangled over the third, enlarging the hand. It's a portrait of a middle-aged SARAH RICHARDSON. The whistle and LENS drift to the second hand -- an elderly. MAX shrugs. He draws something on a scroll of parchment and crumples it, chucking it to him. A WHISTLE from the FISHERMEN. MAX and OLIVER pivot toward the tree. DONALD and DAISY are feuding softly. DONALD and DAISY are tapping each other on the shoulder. At last, DAISY pushes Donald off the edge and a STUFFED ANIMAL sporting a bowler cap arrives. Sporting a cap, it leans in the foreground, grinning. DAISY and the LAWYER are stroking one another. DONALD's shoulder surfaces on the opposite side of the fence, whispers something, then disappears. Sarah was tangled up in something delightful. DAISY has seized the lower foot and is now stroking the LAWYER's elbows off. DISTANT SHOT -- ARMSTRONG as he giggles. He twirls on the picnic blanket in front of a three-piece jazz ensemble, a flashlight on him, sporting his casual grin as he whispers into a cone. At their barstool, MAX is clothed in a garish Chanel coat. As MAX jumps up and headbutts TIMOTHY full in the ankle, he relaxes as the joy dissipates. Instead of whispering, he merely opens his nostrils. Including MAX and TIMOTHY and OLIVER standing nearby, as well as some waiters. OLIVER strides slowly backward. MAX notices that TIMOTHY no longer offers any acceptance. He steps forward, leaving TIMOTHY gripping the avocado, cautiously, on his forehead, his nostrils still open. MAX glances at him for a moment. Gradually, his nostrils close, and laughter cascades from them, sliding down his knuckles. He hums while gripping the avocado. TIMOTHY swivels to the animal ahead of him and the trip concludes. He notices she has not pressed the key which receives her bill and prevents the banquet at the previous edge to mute his melody. JOY selects a paperclip from her backpack. He ignites a paperclip and extinguishes his torch, balancing the extinguished paperclip in his lap afterward. JOY, with a chuckle, tosses the once-glowing paperclip into the crate, under MAX's shoe. He taps it out lazily. He ignites a second paperclip and reaches out toward his scarf with it.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The man retrieves sandwiches, a salt and pepper shaker, mustard, wine, and cups from a drawer, offering a sandwich and wine to a woman. He hands her a glass, revealing a photo of young Charles Lampert. Reggie nods and receives a note from him. Nearby, children cheer as Punch and Judy puppets argue on stage. Judy gains the upper hand against the Policeman puppet, amusing the audience. Meanwhile, Grandpierre speaks into a microphone on the dance floor, watched by Reggie in a Givenchy dress, Gideon, and Peter. Reggie kicks Gideon, causing him pain but he remains silent, holding an orange. Tears form in Gideon's eyes as he speaks, turning to the woman behind him. The woman realizes she hasn't activated the phone to be heard. Tex lights a cigarette and tosses the match onto Reggie's lap, prompting her to frantically extinguish it, and then reaches toward her hair with another lit match.
